alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:32AM EDT until May 03 at 3:49AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine...New Hampshire... Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Franklin, Oxford and Androscoggin Counties. Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Cumberland, Sagadahoc and Androscoggin Counties. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. For the Androscoggin River...including Gorham, Rumford, Auburn... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Warner River...including Davisville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Androscoggin River near Auburn. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. At 13.5 feet, Route 136 at Stackpole Road in Durham begins to flood. At 14.8 feet, Route 136 at Stackpole Road in Durham floods to a depth of 1 foot. North River Road in Auburn floods. Water rises up to the retaining wall behind Roak Block on Main Street in Auburn. At 15.5 feet, The parking lot behind Roak Block on Main Street in Auburn floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 14.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
